Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone with a client] I just wanted to check and see if there's anything you needed before I went on my maternity leave... Yeah, I'm pregnant... Great, well, I'll write up the order. Okay, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait a minute! You can't do that. You cannot exploit your baby for sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey, did I tell you we were going to have a baby? Oh, thank you very much. I'm excited. Oh, definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no! You need to come by your sales honorably!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There is nothing dishonorable about talking about your life. People like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone with a client] Hey there. Dwight Schrute here. Listen, uh, would you be interested in restocking on paper? ... Yeah, I could sure use the money. My cousin, uh, came down with a case of that nasty new goat fungus. Oh, it's just horrific. The doctor says he'd never seen it beard so quickly. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need a baby. I'll never outsell Jim and Pam without one. Also, I've been noticing a gaping hole in my life. Sometimes I wake up cradling a gourd.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, you're such a gourmand.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I cooked my way through Julia Childs' cookbook, and now, I'm halfway through the Twilight cookbook. Last night, I had Edward's corn flake chicken.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pregnant Pam and I, we get hungry at the same times, so we've been eating together a lot. Not all meals. Just second breakfast, lunch, second lunch, and first dinner.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I thought that maybe we should do something special for early dinner. One last ultra feast.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmmm, that sounds great. What are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think it should be a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [After Pam has a contraction] Oh, getting there, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no. I still have time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm having contractions, but they're irregular and far apart. So I'm not really in labor, I'm near labor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, we're slow-playing it because of our stupid HMO.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: If we check in after midnight, I get an extra day to recuperate surrounded by doctors.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not to mention the extra night's sleep in the hospital will be very nice because once we bring the baby home, if it's crying all night, one of us is going to have to take care of it. And I do not plan on helping unless it's a boy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I cannot wait for that joke to be over.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, oh! Contraption! She's contrapting! Okay, you know what? I think I should drive you guys to the hospital, and here is why. I am a licensed, classy driver in the state of Pennsylvania. I gassed up the car...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, I put diesel in this time, trying to save some money.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, you shouldn't have done that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Happy to do it. Also, I did a heck of a job baby-proofing this office.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know the baby's not going to live here, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, the baby was conceived here, so might as well live here a little bit, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm, that logic's air-tight, but unfortunately it wasn't conceived here. Burning man, port-o-potty.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, yuck! TMI! How was it? I don't want to know. Tell me later. Let's go! Let's go! Hospital!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, we're not going to the hospital. We are waiting until midnight.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ooh, spooky. But why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because the insurance company only covers two nights.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everything's fine. We have plenty of time.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Well, you don't want to wait too long, Pam. Otherwise the baby's going to become a teenager in there and you'll be up all night, from the rock music.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up, Nick. What a weird thing to say. Weird I.T. nerd. Don't get revenge on me, nerd.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [as Nick looks over at her] What are you looking at?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha, nerd.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Did you know that labor can last weeks? Then they take your insides out and they just plop them on a table, and sometimes epidurals don't work, and you can poop yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [with Angela in the break room] Bare my child.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want to have a child for business reasons and I want you to be the mother. If you agree, say nothing. If you disagree, say anything... Very well. Let's meet at 4:00 PM at our old meeting spot and bang it out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after Pam has another contraction] That's seven minutes. Here we go. This is happening. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hold on, hold on. It isn't midnight yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you serious? Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, the doctor said every five to seven minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I... Pam, please.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm going to be okay, we should really try to make it until midnight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, no, you really should. Because if your baby's born tomorrow, he's going to have the same birthday as Butt-mud Brooks. My old roommate.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you hear that? Butt-mud Brooks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, but we are leaving at five minutes apart.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Five minutes apart.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, the plan was seven minutes. But we're calling an audible, because that's her call. Because she's the quarterback. I'm just the left tackle who happened to get her pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, stop watching me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, crazy. I think I have some better things to do with my day than worry about you, like sell printers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well not until Friday 20% off toner cartridges, that's a big deal. While we're on the subject, why don't I just run you down to the hospital and we'll just do a quick check?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not until midnight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Guys. Word of advice. Speaking as a former baby. Don't get too hung up on baby names. I was named Walter Jr. after my father until I was about six or so, when my parents changed their minds.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I thought you said your younger brother was named Walter Jr.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My brother was born, and my parents felt he better exemplified the Walter Jr. name, so they gave it to him. I was given Andrew, which they got out of a baby name book.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, it's getting real crowded in here. Maybe you guys should all go back to work because the day's not out yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no. You know what? You can't tell us what to do because you are not co-manager anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Andy and Kevin shout "yeah!" in response to Michael] Okay, I feel like this noise is going to prevent Pam from being able to listen to her body's signals.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Actually, the distractions are good. I mean, I don't think I'm going to make it until midnight if I'm just sitting here thinking about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Distractions are good! That means conference room, five minutes! No, no, five seconds! Right now, right now! Conference room! Topic, potpourri! Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I am sort of a master of distraction. When I was a kid, my mom received compliments left and right from my teachers on how I was always able to distract others in class. Try to think, what were the first thirteen colonies? Mm-hmm, mm-hmm. [Michael covers his mouth and makes fart noises.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The purpose for this meeting is to take Pam's mind off of what's going on inside of her body.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can we do sleight of hand tricks?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will allow that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! Can anyone do those?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm going to go look at the Internet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Pam has another contraction] Oh! Oh, alright. That's a good one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay, uh, sorry, guys. Just, um, keep talking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, Pam, you are a woman warrior.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Does anybody have anything? Anything interesting, any hobbies, uh, special skills?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, this is the only time I'm ever going to make this request.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Phyl?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I can put on lipstick the way Molly Ringwald does in The Breakfast Club.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [ as Pam shakes her head] Nope, nope, I don't think anybody wants to see that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can do the evolution of dance-dance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Pam gives the thumbs up] That sounds good! Do you need some music, or...? Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nope, actually music would just throw me off. I need complete silence. Okay... [Pam begins to clap as Andy dances] You're clapping. I need complete silence. Totally threw me off, so I'm going to have to start over. Evolution of dance-dance.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [reading from a book as Kelly admires] "You let me in your bed. But now, I sleep alone. Trapped with the forgotten in my detritus home."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [naming race horses] Affirmed. Seattle Slew. Secretariat. Citation. Assault. Count Fleet. Whirlaway. War Admiral. Omaha. Gallant Fox... And... I know this. Uh... The jockey was Johnny Loftus. Sired by Star Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good afternoon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Before we conceive a child, uh, it is important that we bang out a parenting contract.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's been a long time since we've come down here separately.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know I was thinking...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now, then. Let's get to it, shall we? Item one:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Pam has another contraction] Where are we? We have every six minutes, ladies and gentlemen. Another seventy five contractions and you are going to be there.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: For the love of God, Pam, do it for ultra feast!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? I'm going to go give, uh, doctor Asmani a quick call. He'd probably know...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, please. Happy thoughts here. Happy times.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, happy times. Come on. Let's have happy times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, as a matter of fact, I have printed out ten ways to induce labor. And I'm thinking we just do the opposite of those things and we can slow down your labor. Erin, read the first one.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Um, stimulate the nipples.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, nobody touch Pam's nipples. Think of Pam's nipples as Toby's grundle.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Her shirt is touching them. Maybe we should cut holes in her shirt.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I have a shirt like that in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah, why don't you go get it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, uh, the second one is walk around. We're already doing the opposite of that. Perfect. Okay, number three, eat spicy foods.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, the opposite of that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Stick spicy food up her butt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, nope, nope, nope. Come on, let's go to the hospital. Pam, let's go to the hospital right now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, Jim, honey, I love you, but you're really distracting me from my distractions.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Okay, great. Well, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why don't you go do some work?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. I will do that. Sorry, Pam, I just feel a little bit frazzled. And you know how very rarely I use that word. Frazzled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know, you don't like to be frazzled.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, and by the way, hate that you're helping her with this right now. Totally.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ooh, someone's freakin'.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A little frazzled.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think he is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know Pam better than anyone in this office, and obviously she's gone crazy, but everybody wants to say that I'm crazy. But I'm not crazy, she's crazy. I'm not crazy, she's crazy. [reading from various books] Five to seven minutes. Five to seven minutes. Six minutes. Different, but not really. Five to seven minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Acceptable names include and are limited to:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam approaches as he sits in his car] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. I'm not going to get in the car, because I know if I do you'll try to drive me to the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, you know me too well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah? ... Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Everything is fine. You don't have to worry. Try not to think about it. She's not coming out for a while, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you say "she?"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I called the doctor like a week ago. I couldn't wait... Oh, God, don't be mad.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mad? How could I be mad? We're having a little girl.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, we're having a little girl. Oh, man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Woo, alright. Well, I definitely feel better.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright... Hey, did you change?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, my water broke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [enters the office and has another contraction] Oh, whoa. Ha. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, Pam! Okay, alright, okay, it's time. Time to go to the hospital. Somebody get Jim, please! Is it midnight yet?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, it's 4:35.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 4:35. Alright, almost made it. Almost made it. Too bad you didn't have sex like seven and a half hours later. But you had to have the afternoon delight. I understand. Sometimes you have to go for it. Let's go to the hospital, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, not yet, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We can do...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wow, it's almost time for ultra feast! Where's Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. What? You want to eat cat food with Kevin and not go to the hospital?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's fancy feast. Ultra feast is something they made up so they can pig out together in the name of ceremony.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is October feast?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There is no rush to get to the hospital. I am fine. I'll get there. And if I don't get there, I don't get there.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Our ultra feast menu's theme:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got it! I got it! Everybody it's go time! At your stations. Stanley, man the phones. Meredith, please, get bottled water. Erin, call an ambulance, please!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Ambulances are emergencies only. You call an ambulance, I call the cops.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, we're driving ourselves, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Jim, you are in no condition to drive. I will drive you. Check! Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, I have my wallet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go bag's in the car... Keys, my keys, where's my keys?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go bag! Where's my go bag? Where's my go bag?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There's nothing in it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are telling me now that there is nothing in it. Okay, great! Oh, hey, hey, um, should I bring a dictionary to the hospital?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The hospital provides dictionaries, bring a thesaurus!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Has anyone checked how dilated she is? This is ridiculous!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, get away!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Dwight, let Jim do that, please.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I didn't know we had a tape measure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as he holds up the tape measure with his initials on it] "We" don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I can't find my keys! I cannot find my keys! Found 'em. They're here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight, Jim and Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Good luck!

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Good luck, Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you! Wish me luck!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Have fun! [sigh]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, it's 5:00!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering the elevator] Here we go! Here we go! On our way!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hold it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, Stanley! Okay. We're going now!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, one more!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no! Out, out! Idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, what is the traffic like?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Doesn't matter. I'll escort you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Geesh, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as he peels out of the parking lot and stops] Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is where I saw that deer last week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right over by that fence.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: By the bushes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael! Focus!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, go, go, go, go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I love escorting people. In fact, a few years back, I put an ad in the paper starting an escort service. I got a lot of responses. Mostly creeps. Made a few friends.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, here we go! You're doing great! She'll be here soon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, just breathe... She? You found out? Come on, guys. I wanted to be surprised.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop texting, put your phone away! Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm texting about you, okay!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ugh, alright. [as he puts a police siren on top of his car] Let's move! ... What?

Quote.Speaker: Policeman
Quote.Text: Pull over!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Policeman
Quote.Text: Pull over! [Dwight begins throwing various weapons out of the window] You're not allowed to impersonate a police officer! Don't make this difficult, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. My iPod's not in here!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It has the birth song on it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I know, I know. But my iPod is in the go bag. We'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, I don't want the first thing the baby hears to be the 8 Mile soundtrack.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so what do you want to do?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know! Let's go by the house and get it. It's only twenty minutes past the hospital!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, no! Are you nuts? We're going to the hospital now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, guys! Stop fighting, come on. Come on. Do you want your kid to come out a lawyer? Right? Okay, you know what? I am all over this. Here we go. [as he calls Dwight] Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight. Pam left her iPod at her house. I want you to swing by, pick it up, and bring it to the hospital. We need it yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why didn't you ask me to do it yesterday? I kept IM'ing you how bored I was.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight! Go to my house. Get my iPod. I think it's on the kitchen table. Do not touch anything else. The key is under...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't need a key.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight, but if you do need a key, just listen it's under the...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, don't, don't tell me. Alalalalalalalalalala lalalalalala alalalalalalalala.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight just listen! It's underneath... [Dwight hangs up as the policeman hands him a ticket]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, you alright?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you have everything, guys?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, just go park the car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, alright. [he parks in an ambulance zone]

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Sir! You can't park here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin. It's okay. [he throws the keys into bushes across the street] I just did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam's doing great. Uh, she's ten inches dilated now. Uh, sorry, meters. Centimeters. And she's also fully faced. Which I don't know what that is, uh, but no baby yet. It's only been six, uh, nineteen hours, and uh, I just went out for some ice chips because I might have passed out a little bit, but these are very refreshing, very good.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Daddy? She's ready to push.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where is my little nibblet? Halpert, room D1. Alright, family only beyond this point, thank you. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Pam screams] Doing great, push again.

Quote.Speaker: Doctor
Quote.Text: Not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, don't push. Pull. Pull.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Why don't you get more ice chips?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Jim, stay!

Quote.Speaker: Doctor
Quote.Text: Okay. Really push this time, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking horrified as he walks from the room back into the lobby] Okay, not yet, not yet. I'm going to go wash my eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That kid's going to have a lot of hair.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, have you guys seen her?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: She hasn't popped yet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? God damn it. She was supposed to come out yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I decided to give baby Halpert a newspaper from the day she was born. This frame set me back fifty five bones. But she decided to take her sweet time, so now I have to switch it with today's paper.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous. We just can't wait here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think it's going to be any minute now.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: But you don't know that. I mean, we could be here another half an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis, what could you possibly have to do?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have an ice cream cake in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Go, go, go! Are you insane? Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Pam screams as he approaches the door to their room] Guys? Hello? Um, sorry to be a bother, but if we could have an ETA when this is gonna...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is happening!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're starting, you're kinda losing them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! Look at her! baby, she's so beautiful! Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [smoking a cigar] Yeah, that's right. It's a baby, see?

Quote.Speaker: Doctor
Quote.Text: Sir! Sir, you can't smoke that in here. Put it, put it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You can't smoke anywhere these days.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [with Jim, holding the baby] She's incredible. Want to count her fingers and toes again?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, let's let her rest. I'm sure there's still twelve on each.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, guys!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Her name is Cecelia Marie Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eleven pounds...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's seven pounds, two ounces, eighteen inches. Mother and daughter are doing great.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you! Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Congratulations. That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Hi there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, grandma's back.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Well, it was an adventure and a half trying to find the cafeteria, but I have returned with the coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thank God. I haven't had caffeine in nine months.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Ooh, somebody has a full diaper.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Let me get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am a diapering master. I have done little else in the past two months. There is nothing I cannot diaper. Go ahead. Try to think of something. I dare you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where's the baby? I want to see the baby. Oh! Oh, Helene, hi. Oh, my goodness, what are the odds of this? Congratulations on being a grandma.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Hello, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. Oh, good for you. I worry about you.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: I'm, uh... You know I think, uh, I think it's time for me to go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Love you, as a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Love you, mom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ooh, I want to hold the baby!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, you just have to use the hand sanitizer first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Again, no pants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Oh. Ooh, wow. Michael. Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's so weird, she was saying it just before you got here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yesterday, I was dispatched to Jim and Pam's house to find Pam's iPod. I searched everywhere, but I didn't find it. What I did find, was mold, and lots of it. So, I did what anyone would do. Read a book, had a bath, I got a good night's sleep, and I made plans to eradicate it. I also made plans to ask Jim where he bought his marvelous sheets... Time to get to work [he begins to destroy the kitchen with a sledgehammer].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There she sat. Her name was Pam. She was a receptionist. She was engaged to an animal. There sat Jim. He was a gawky, tall salesman. The odds of them getting together were insur-mountain-able. I made a family! I got these two together, and I made a family.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This man has a gift!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who else here is single?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm not single. I have a man. [she grasps Ryan's arm as Ryan has his hand raised to say he's single]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am offering up my services to you all. You saw what I did with Pam and Jim. I can help you, too.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why do you find someone for yourself instead of meddling in our affairs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, show of hands. Who wants to live in a world where Stanley has two lovers and you don't have any? [Stanley raises his hand] Who else? Come on! People, I know models!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ha ha, plus size models, maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ha ha, you got that right! Meredith? Come on, you're obviously single.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You know it. I am never getting married.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Like Clooney.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andrew, what about you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Torn scrotum. Still on the mend, so not good timing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm going to ask out Erin. I'm just waiting for the stars to align. Literally. I have a small skylight in my bedroom, and I'd like for the moon to be visible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, when you least expect it, expect it. I am going to fill the empty voids in your life with love. I am going to fill that empty hole in your body with another person. And, like Cupid, I am going to shoot you with love.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Remember yesterday when we were terrified of being parents?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We were just kids. What did we know?

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: How we doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Would you like me to take her to the nursery for the night?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Doesn't she sleep here?

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: She can. But a lot of parents choose to have the baby spend the first night in the nursery to get some rest. You've been through a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think we'll be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Okay, great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [as the baby yawns] Oh, big yawn.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ready? One, two, three...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: One, and then wrap around. It's okay. Hold that arm down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't. She's too strong. She's, careful, though. You don't want to break it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's not gonna... Just...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I got it. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nurse!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. I just, I can't tell if she's getting anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Doesn't feel right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you're pushing the milk out, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How does one do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wasn't it... It's kinda like a... Like that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you want to try it, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you're good. Doing a good job.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Somebody buzzed?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Really? Must have sat on it, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't tell if she's getting anything. It just doesn't really feel right.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Well, maybe we should take a break for a little while. I can take her to the nursery and then bring her back and try again a little bit later.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Even if she's not getting anything?

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Yeah, she'll be fine. I can always give her a bottle since we're in the nursery.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. I read in the book about nipple confusion.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Oh, good. You know everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's just, she's really tentative about latching, and I just, I want to keep her self-esteem up.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Well, I'll bring her back in a little while and we can try again, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's going to be alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe it'll be good because then she can like socialize with the other babies.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ha ha. No, yeah, that will be good.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [in Michael's office] You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What would you say, if I told you that I was about to change your life?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, boy! ... What's that sound?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [as he appears from behind the door] Ta-da!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like you to meet your new boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't know what to say.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, say nothing. You will learn to love me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, hold on. Whoa, whoa, whoa. You got to let the cookies cool before you pop 'em in your mouth. Why don't you guys get to know each other? Maybe have lunch together?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Erin, would you have lunch with me?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, could I talk to you privately?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. Kevin, please leave.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry if I gave you the impression I'm into Kevin, but I'm not. I like Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. This is going to kill Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm sure he'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not so sure. Kevin has an enormous heart. Literally, he has an elephant heart. He had a transplant when he was seventeen. Had some problems, blah blah blah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Kevin doesn't have an elephant heart. But he is very sensitive. And it won't kill Erin just to go and have lunch with him in the break room like I promised him... I bet his heart is enlarged, though.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't want anyone to die.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just don't let him sit on you... I'm kidding. You'll have fun. It'll be good. It'll be good. There he is. Go to him.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She touched my shoulder.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Hey, guys. We're short on rooms, so this is Dale and Kathy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Dale
Quote.Text: Hi, so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Careful... Wow, she just shoves the nipple right in there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You see that? I'm pretty sure she's... Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight and friends continue to destroy the Halperts' kitchen with hammers]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Did you grow up around here?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So, you must have grown up around somewhere else?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why was I hiding behind the plant? Ha, well, in college, I took a botony class, and there was lots of drama in that class. Uh, kids would gossip about me, so I would eavesdrop on them by hiding behind different plants in the botony class. And then, uh, they would say things like "Oh, this guy's going to fail this class," or, "What's this guy doing spying on us from behind plants?" And then I would jump out of them and confront them, and be like, "Oh, you think all I do is hide behind plants and spy on people? Busted." ... Oh, the reason? The reason I was hiding behind that plant in this situation was that I thought that Erin and Kevin were kind of hitting it off, and... I was jealous.

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Uh, hi, Pam Halpert?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Hi. I'm Clark. Josie said you might benefit from a lactation consultant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, yeah, that would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup. Really great. When's she available?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Actually, uh, I'm the consultant. Got milk? Ha ha. Alright, let's see what we're working with.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, uh, biggest thing, besides not being able to get her to latch...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I'll get that for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. Is that um, I can't tell if I'm really producing. I don't know if she's getting anything.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Okay. Let me feel here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's quite full. Why don't you put your hand on top of my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: When you're feeding, you want to press in like this, make your hand in a C. Uh, does that hurt?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I mean, it feels... pressure.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you sure it doesn't hurt?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. It just feels like pressure.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Okay, well. Feel how I'm flicking the nipple? Like that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Stimulate it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Alright, so you just want to do that, and that will, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: And you can just... The baby should grab on to that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think she will.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. So, I'm just not sure if I'm releasing, though. I'm not sure if...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We'll figure it out.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: It doesn't... Why don't you bring your baby over here... She's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Aw, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yes, congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, you're doing a good job. Just stay relaxed, and I'll come back in a bit to check on you. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Please do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shoot, she fell off.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, try the torpedo thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Will you just, will you grab Clark real quick?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No need. I saw him do it. I can try it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, Jim, please, please, please, I think it'd be weird if you did it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll just go get the other guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey, what's up, kid?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Have you had a chance to look over the revisions on the contract I've prepared for you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing left to do except dot the I's, the J's, and the umlauts. Why don't you meet me here at exactly mid-late afternoon?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I look forward to it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very well.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [trying to sleep as the baby cries] Jim, Jim, get her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Get the baby. Get her. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Sshh. I know. [hands the baby to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I got her. Okay. Okay. Okay... Jim! She latched! She latched.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. I didn't even have to do the "C thing."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aw, we're doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: that's great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're really parents now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin. Erin would like a few words with you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I have really enjoyed our time together.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I want to continue working on our friendship.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Really, really fun.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Because I think our friendship could be a really cool thing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And, you're my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And I hope that I'm your friend... And, maybe...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God, this is agonizing. Look, Kevin, do you really think that you could have dated Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You said she liked me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, even if someone told you that, you should know that that could never be possible, Kevin. And I'm surprised that you didn't question me in the first place.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I've dumped better than Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Lynn was way hotter than Erin, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lynn was as hot as Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael, but you dated Holly and Jan, and they were so much hotter than you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This isn't about me, and that is debatable. And I have a personality, where as you... Yes, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [he hits his head on the desk after ducking out of the way from hiding behind a plant] Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kev... Nice. Going.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Knock knock.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, Isabelle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Hey. Pam, she's gorgeous. Can I hold her?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. She was a little fussy earlier, but she's totally quieted down. Here, let me just, uh, let me just burp her. I don't want her to spit up on you. Come here, sweety... Oh, my God! Wrong baby!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wrong baby! This is not our baby! Sshh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: [waking up] Oh,has she been fussing long?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Kathy
Quote.Text: I was out like a light... Oh, she's not hungry...

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I feel like she needs to eat, but she won't latch on, which is weird, because the other baby di...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ha ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Bottles are fine. A lot of babies grow up using bottles. So are you excited to bring your baby home?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We definitely are. At 3:00, right? You said we could stay until 3:00?

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Yeah, you can. It's 2:35.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Half hour.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Twenty five minutes. And you're all set with the car seat?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, car seat's right there.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: That bottom part needs to go in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Newsflash, the whole thing needs to go in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: Ha ha, be back in twenty five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Or it could be a half hour, if you need it to be... Can we get a late checkout? I don't... I don't think she heard me.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: [entering the Halpert house] Hello? Dwight? What, what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Isabelle. Hello... Yeah, the uh, kitchen was disgusting, so...

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Wow, ha. New cabinets.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: All I did was bring macaroni and cheese... Where's the fridge?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it's... In the backyard. I'll take this.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Oh... Well, I'll let you get back to it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, listen. I know that I'm an adult, but maybe I could come by sometime for a teeth cleaning. You know, just for fun.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Well, adults are supposed to go to the dentist, too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are they now? Ha ha, how some people spend their money, right? Ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright. I'll call you, kid.

Quote.Speaker: Isabelle
Quote.Text: Do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you really sure we should be leaving?

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you hear the baby crying, right?

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm... Where's your car?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, it's in the lot.

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Oh, a lot of fathers bring their car around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right, okay. Yes, that would be the smart thing to do. Uh, Pam, I will be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, please hurry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin, uh, I need you to send this fax immediately. It's really important, so I'm going to stand here and wait for the confirmation.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The fax says "Erin, will you have dinner with me?" from Andy, and the number is our office fax number.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's busy. Why don't I keep trying, and then I'll give you the confirmation in a bit?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sorry, that's unacceptable. I need you to send it immediately, or you're fired.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [tearing up] You can't talk to me like that. I didn't do anything wrong. I've been having a tough day today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, God, no. I'm... Just read the fax.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You read the fax.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm... I'm asking you out.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. That's amazing. Let me just fax this, and I'll check my planner.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, it's a date.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. Do you have a day in mind?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, what day? What day?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Everyday is fine. Or...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, that, what's that one?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thursday?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Would you like me to help you up out of the chair?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Hospital employee
Quote.Text: Yeah, we just got a lot of discharges today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, alright, thanks... Okay, do you want to eat? You want to try eating? Okay... Okay, let me... Just you and me. Come on. There we go... Yeah... Oh, yeah. Like that. There we go. You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Five tickets on the windshield... Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi. We did it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You used my move, didn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I used a variation of your move.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [smoking a cigar] There is no greater feeling than when two people who are perfect for each other overcome all obstacles, and find true love. And that is what I thought that Erin and Kevin were going to find today... I think I'm going to be sick...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Two forms of ID, please.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And now you, two forms of ID, please... Alright, all is in order. I just need your signature... What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Alright. How would you like to celebrate?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just pour yourself a cup of apple juice. I feel sick... [Jim and Pam walk in to their house with the baby] I couldn't find the iPod... Give me a couple days. I'll be out of your hair.
